pros: Friendly staff who make you feel at home.

job_title: Assistant Preschool Teacher in Golden Valley, MN
pros: - Good 401B matching - Friendly work environment - Paid work development - Free lunch and snacks - Great kids and families
cons: - Low starting salary - Mandatory overtime - Long shifts - One 30 min break

pros: Kids are ready to learn and are well. Erased in respecting their teachers. A solid, very positive learning environment is a given, which is wonderful for any and all teachers.
cons: Completely unsupportive, passive aggressive administration that does not trust their teachers.. Majority of parents spoil their children and let them off the hook often, thereby ironically interfering g with the education of their children. The administration allows this to occur because it is detached, stoic and numb. The administration  wishes  to appear supportive so there is a lot of lip service by the administration  to the parents and to the teachers in front of the parents, followed by backstabbing  by the administration to the teachers. The only survivors are the teachers that are brown  nose-era. EVERY teacher, and employee for that matter walks around on egg shells because, no matter who the headmaster is, people historically get the axe very suddenly without warning. It has been  a secretary employed 20+ years, a school counselor of 15 years, a janitor of 6 years. Actually there is a bitter  teachers union formed in the 1980's against a crazy headmaster, so the classroom teachers are harder to fire- but they do get fired. For example, a teacher was fired for being pregnant out of wedlock, so it was rumored. MANY sexual  scandals in the school historically and currently.

pros: Great work environment, great school! Other teachers are very helpful
cons: Very restrictive at times.  Always being watched, but like any other school that is because you are with children.  Much oversight as a teacher.

pros: Staff is amazing.  Professional development is top notch!  Students are respectful and well mannered.
cons: Parental involvement can be a bit much.  Parents tend to go to heads of schools instead of talking with teachers directly.

pros: People are easy to work with
